100 The Jeake Family of Rye, 1640-1736

Sir pray remember me to your Father, my Cosin Boys, Mr Miller, Mr Gee, & all other Friends with you, & if you have any new Intelligence for France or elsewhere, to give me 2 or 3 lines of it.

To Mr Samuel Jeake Jun in Rye these

[66] Samuel Jeake senior to Samuel Jeake junior, 23 February 1678. Original letter. ESRO FRE 4862

Loving son

These are only to acquaint you that through mercy I got well to London this Afternoone about 4 a clocke our Company riding but softly & Mr Crouch desires you would let his family know that he got well up also. I can write you no news yet for the war® the talke is as various here as in the countrey & way- ers. I heare at the Coffee houses some for warr & some for peace, Cosins here are in different but Cosin Mackley’s little one is dead, & Cosin Jane hath got acold. My horse carried me very well & I am not very weary. Remember m to Cosin Freebody and his wife & Cosin Mary & all my friends that aske after my welfare not else but my kind love to you & hearty desire of a blessing on you all in hast I subscribe

London Febr 23" Your lo: father 1677/8 Sa: Jeake

To his lo sonne Samuel Jeake in Rye Sussex these

Trading in Tallow, 1678

[67] Christopher Blackwood to Samuel Jeake junior, 23 April 1678. Original letter, ESRO FRE 486
